results:
Based on my search results, I found information about a Polish radio adaptation of "Tom Sawyer" (Tomek Sawyer), though not specifically from Radio Dwójka. Here's what I discovered:

There was a Polish radio production called "Bajki Grajki: Przygody Tomka Sawyera" (Singing Tales: The Adventures of Tom Sawyer), produced by Polish Radio and recorded in 1997. The text was adapted by Roman Kołakowski based on Mark Twain's work, with music by Zbigniew Karnecki.

The cast included notable Polish actors such as Robert Gonera, Jolanta Fraszyńska, Wojciech Kościelniak, Mariusz Kiljan, Konrad Imiela, Jan Blecki, Monika Bolly, Adam Cywka, Ferdynand Matysik, Mariusz Drężek, and the Spirituals Singers Band, along with the Wrocław Chamber Orchestra "Leopoldinum".

This was described as a musical radio drama for children, where "kids love fairy tales, and these in the form of musical radio plays are wonderful: children learn them by heart at breakneck speed, easily acquire new vocabulary, learn rhythm and become more musical, develop imagination and even theatrical talents".

Additionally, I found that Polish Radio PiK featured "The Adventures of Tom Sawyer" in their "We Read for You" (Czytamy dla Ciebie) series.

While I couldn't find specific evidence of a Radio Dwójka adaptation with that exact title, the "Bajki Grajki" series was a production of Polish Radio and represents a significant Polish radio adaptation of Mark Twain's classic work.
